Title: *IND SW Engineering Template*
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are looking for a passionate Backend Software Engineer to join the Fulfillment Optimization team. This team builds the platforms that determine how customer orders are fulfilled, optimizing for Wayfair profitability and customer delight. A big part of our work revolves around enhancing and scaling customer-facing platforms that provide fulfillment information on our websites, starting at the top of the customer funnel on the search pages all the way through orders being delivered. Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet the department's technical vision
Work closely with product managers, designers, and peer engineering teams to define project requirements and execution plans

Title: Software Engineer II, Cybersecurity Opertaions
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We are:
Wayfair is the online leader for home furnishings and decor. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 8 million items across home furnishings, dcor, home improvement, housewares and more. 
Wayfair operates a growing Security Operations Center and were looking for a talented Security Engineer to join and help grow our team. Our Security Operations team is tasked with monitoring and protecting Wayfair from an ever growing number of security risks, and finding new and creative ways to do so. We have a strong focus on engineering and innovation, and are seeking individuals who love to find new problems and hate fixing the same problem twice.
 
What Youll Do

In this role you will work closely with the cyber security organization to build monitoring and response tooling and processes to reduce our mean-time-to-detect and remediate to keep up with threat actors changing tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs)
Logging - Gather all security relevant cloud, infrastructure and application logs parsed, and  into our SIEM
Detection - Setup detection and prevention rules and policies, PoC and deploy tools that help with detection, tune/audit deployed rules/policies in security tools on true and false positives, setting up a detection framework
Response - Build plan and procedures for Incident Response, create playbooks to be followed, automate response, develop/deploy malware analysis tools and techniques, forensic tools and techniques to capture evidence/malware, PoC and deploy tools that help with response, integrate with customer service teams and engineering teams etc.
Build security alerts & dashboards in various incident response tools. Monitor for suspicious activities/alerts in the cloud/infrastructure/application from various sources such as internal reports from employees as well as external reports such as customers/social media, vendors, partners, bug bounty programs etc., deployed/integrated security tools, data visualization tools etc.
Build and maintain security infrastructure tooling that supports continuous SOC operations and vulnerability management 
As needed, support the response to security alerts and incidents, and take appropriate action to remediate and resolve 

We Are a Match Because You Have:

3+ years experience working in cyber security operations
Understanding of the threat landscape, the latest security trends, attack vectors for corporate and cloud environments, and how build detection and response tooling to identify and respond to malicious actors
Experience with SOAR/SIEM technologies
Experience with incident detection and remediation
Working knowledge of threat vectors, vulnerabilities, and what anomalies to look for
Working knowledge of Linux and/or Windows logs & indicators
Python experience to build and automate tooling
Experience writing SIEM logging parsing rules
Experience with incident response and monitoring tools, such as SIEM, EDR, cloud monitoring, etc.
Strong communication skills to describe challenges and roadblocks when building and maintaining our security operations tooling and logging
Understanding of cyber security best practices and frameworks such as NIST, MITRE, ATT&CK Framework, and OWASP Top 10

Title: Virtual Cabinetry Designer
RoleDescription:
The salary for this position is $50,000 per year + target bonuses of $15,000 per year.
Overview:
Wayfairs Cabinetry team is seeking creative, driven, empathetic, and entrepreneurial design sales consultants to join one of our newest offerings. This virtual role will be instrumental in helping customers envision and create kitchens theyll love, offering recommendations aligned with their budget, style, and space needs. As part of our founding cabinetry design team, youll be at the forefront of delivering exceptional customer experiences and shaping the way customers engage with Wayfair. This role will work very closely with our customers as well as other supporting teams. If you're passionate about design and sales, this could be the next exciting step in your career with Wayfair.
What Youll Do: 

Provide Expertise: Leverage your interior and kitchen design expertise to help navigate our customers through their design needs and purchases
Guide the Purchase Process: Lead customers through the custom cabinetry purchasing process: functional 3D renderings, requesting samples from manufacturers, placing orders for the customer, and upselling compatible products. Youll use key questions with customers that allow you to provide a complete sales solution for their needs
Use Multiple Tools: Navigate through multiple software applications, 3rd party and proprietary tools to provide customers with recommendations for their budget, style and space as well as manage customer ordering and customers post order questions.
Create Functional Designs: Develop detailed, functional 3D kitchen renderings based on customer sketches, planning guides, or blueprints using 2020 Design Software
Meet a High Performance Bar: Meet or exceed your sales, customer satisfaction targets and other established KPIs
Manage Time Efficiently: Prioritize customer experience while managing your time to meet project deadlines
Contribute Ideas and Adapt: Bring a willingness to share innovative ideas and solutions to continuously improve team operations while thriving in a dynamic environment with frequent change.
Ensure a Top Tier Customer Experience: Engage customers with a high degree of empathy and professionalism in ways that ensure great Net Promoter Scores (NPS) for you and Wayfair

What Youll Need (Required):

Remote Technology Proficiency: Experience using technology to drive business results, pivot and ramp on new software or programs quickly.
Cabinetry Sales & Design Experience: 3+ years of previous cabinetry sales & design experience with a track record of meeting or exceeding quotas in a fast paced and rapidly changing sales environment.
Software Proficiency: 3+ years of experience using 2020 Design Live knowledge and experience for enhanced project visualization and streamlined design processes.
Design Knowledge: Understanding of basic design principles, including spatial planning, fabric selection, interior design styles, and trends
Background or Education: Experience in cabinetry, kitchen, interior design with subject matter expertise gained from education, previous roles, or skilled trades.
Top Tier Customer Experience: Youll need strong focus and a sense of urgency on delivering excellent customer service and achieving sales targets
Organizational Skills: Strong organization, self-motivation, communication, and relationship management skills

Team Collaboration: Ability to contribute to the success of team members and collaborate effectively

Technical Proficiency: Proficiency in Google and Microsoft Office applications and the ability to learn new business systems quickly

Sales Experience: 5+ years of sales experience specifically within kitchen or interior design spaces
Education: Bachelors degree in a related field.

Compensation: This position includes a base salary of $50,000 per year, as well as a monthly performance-based bonus structure. The expected range of all-in earnings to be discussed during the interview.

Sales Contests: Participate in regular sales contests for extra earning potential.

OKTA

Professional and empathetic communication with end-users.

Engagement with other Operations associates.

Title: Assistant Store Manager of Guest Experience - Perigold Luxury
RoleDescription:
Assistant Store Manager, Guest Experience Lead
Location: West Palm Beach, FL
 
Brief Overview of Position
Perigold, the destination for luxury home, is opening its first physical retail stores, first-of-their-kind retail destinations of 20-30K square feet, with the best products in all styles and from across our catalog including furniture, decor, housewares, and home improvement categories. Come be a part of it!  We are looking for an Assistant Store Manager, Guest Experience Lead to oversee the end-to-end guest experience in the store. This role will oversee a team of in-store Hosts, Visual Merchants, and Service team members , and report directly into the Store Manager. If you are passionate about luxury experience and/or design, looking for rapid growth, and thrive on constant learning and dynamic challenges, this may be the perfect fit.
 
What youll do 

Oversee store facility and guest service experience elements, including visual merchandising, hosts, community liaison (and events), and guest service agents. 
Maintain a high bar for luxury experience and service excellence in the store environment at all times, and establish this culture with direct reports and broader store team.
Attract, hire, coach, and retain top-performing talent.  
Collaborate with Store Manager to monitor Guest Experience performance metrics, share out to store team, and translate to training and process improvement needed within the store.
Communicate regularly to team on store performance and improvement needs in order deliver an exceptional luxury experience; inspire team excellence.   
In collaboration with corporate field enablement lead and in partnership with our supplier base as needed, develops and executes training curriculum and schedule to drive results in alignment with sales targets and guest experience goals. 
Maintain close communication and collaboration with Corporate visual merchandising and physical retail marketing leads as well as, Guest Service SWAT team, to ensure alignment with standards and troubleshoot issues.
Partner with Store Manager and Leads including Logistics and Sales leads to ensure alignment with greater business requirements and expectations (eg new season planning and execution, stock room organization and supply levels).
Perform key holder and Manager On Duty duties.  

 
What youll need
Experience & Qualifications

3+ years of management experience in a retail or hospitality environment.  
Demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment, including willingness to explore and test innovative ideas and pursue continuous improvement.  
Client-centric mindset.
Strong business acumen, and exceptional analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
Flexibility availability (including mornings, nights, weekends, some holidays).
Candidates must be open to learning how to safely operate a pallet jack (also known as a pallet truck or pump truck) as part of their job responsibilities. Training will be provided to ensure proper handling and safety protocols are followed. Typically, this requires you to be able to lift at least 50lbs or more.

Luxury home or hospitality knowledge and experience required 
Physical Requirements 

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee frequently is required to handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to sit; regularly climb or balance; and frequently stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly, frequently or occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 lbs.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.

 
Compensation & Benefits:

Competitive starting salary + substantial quarterly bonuses. The base pay for this position is $60,386 per year. The base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Medical benefits, financial benefits, and a generous employee discount effective on day one of employment.

Bachelors degree in a quantitative field

Synthesize complex data into compelling narratives that inform decisions and inspire action across all levels of the organization.

Experience navigating matrixed organizations, building relationships across teams, and embedding customer understanding into decision-making at scale.

Background in digital-forward or high-growth organizations.

Title: Workflow Controller
RoleDescription:
Workflow Controller
 
Compensation: The salary range for this position is $119,202.00- $132,446.50per year . The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
The Workflow Controller plays a vital role in staffing, planning, and achieving site specific goals across Wayfair's Fulfillment Network. They work to ensure the accurate, timely, and cost efficient processing of the perfect order to our customers.
What You'll Do

You will create daily operating plans for a site and resolve variances between plan, actuals, and goals. Responsible for building plans at this cadence to align with Site Director and network priorities
Act as the site labor planning champion, taking full ownership of all labor planning inputs such as headcount, UPH for each process path, flow paths, absenteeism, attrition and product mix and determine the labor capacity needed across each process path on a daily and weekly basis to achieve business objectives
Develop a system for risk management based on demand and capacity of Critical Pull Times (CPTs) for customer orders; proactively monitor risk and recommend actions to Operations team to mitigate risk
You will monitor plans and work in process backlogs to consider impacts of future planning and staffing
You will provide input to strategic shift planning at the site to ensure the building is staffed according to mid-long term volume projections
Coordinate with local site operations and central planning teams to analyze historical data and forecast demand for that site
Manage and interpret the analyses of daily, weekly, and monthly reporting of site performance via Key Performance Indicators (Service Level Commitments)
You will be able to engage at shift level, in real time to make proactive changes to support execution of the daily operations plan
Youll be responsible for facilitating problem solving efforts when goals are not met based on current inputs to daily plan - i.e. Attrition, Absenteeism, Productivity
You will support site operations team by optimizing staffing requirements for the site specific daily plan
You will build a strong relationship with the site operations team to ensure proper execution of the daily level capacity / throughput plan through education in visibility to data and constant communication
Work in close collaboration with Sales and Operations Planning, Workforce Management, peer Workflow Controllers and Fulfillment Improvement Team to enable performance management improvements

What You'll Need

3+ years operational experience in distribution or manufacturing.
Able to guide and influence peers and leaders across levels and organization. Disseminate information effectively.
Capacity Planning experience or Industrial Engineering background focused on operations flow and labor management
Technical aptitude in multiple systems; understanding of Google Suite, Data Visualization platforms, basic SQL/GBQ.
Bachelors Degree in a quantitative field (engineering, economics, math, and statistics), business or equivalent
Basic and working knowledge of Six Sigma tools and Lean techniques; process focused, organized and able to assess change management requirements
Strong understanding in the use of technical/statistical tools to drive process improvements

An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, MA, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
The salary range for this position is $161,000 - $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will also be provided as part of the compensation package.
 
Who We Are
 
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our Product team plays a critical role in making this vision a reality by building technology that solves meaningful customer problems in elegant, scalable, and measurable ways. We work closely with Engineering, Experience Design, Analytics, Third Party system and service providers and business leaders across the company to bring these solutions to life.
We are seeking an experienced Senior Product Manager for Supply Chain and Retail Technology to lead the build out of our Fulfillment Lifecycle State and Orchestration system. This tech provides instructions needed for various supply chain tech systems to fulfill the order and subsequently, keeps track of the fulfillment journey to take appropriate actions based on the happy and unhappy path scenarios. In this role, you will have the opportunity to operate in a greenfield space and be hands-on to build something that plays a critical role within the Wayfair supply chain ecosystem.
Youll act as a connective tissue between engineering, business stakeholders, operations, and external partners to deliver scalable and resilient solutions that power key business functions. This is a high-impact role for someone who thrives in cross-functional environments, can manage complex technical ecosystems, and is passionate about building something foundational and large scale that powers Wayfair supply chain. 
 
What youll do:

Build out the Fulfillment Lifecycle State and Orchestration systems by supporting new use cases and furthering the role that this system plays within Wayfair supply chain 
Lead Cross-Functional Initiatives by being the product lead for major, time-sensitive programs like 3P WMS integration, and Multichannel capabilities that bring value for the business and customers
Define future looking use cases through learnings from the existing capabilities, strong product discovery, and stakeholder feedback for mid to long term buildout.
Lead discovery efforts to gather and translate stakeholder needs into clear business and technical requirements.
Collaborate independently with Operations and Commercial stakeholders, and technology teams across supply chain, storefront and supplier-facing to drive improvements in speed, cost and customer experience metrics.

 
We Are A Match Because You Have:
 

7+ years of product management experience, ideally focused on enterprise platforms, or integrations.
Strong track record of product discovery, defining the right problems to solve, and executing deliverables to solve those problems and unlock business outcomes
Comfortable discussing system workflows, tech design, and architecture decisions with engineers.
Experience in managing complex projects involving multiple cross-functional teams. 
Skilled at managing stakeholders, including senior leadership, and translating technical concepts for non-technical audiences.
Strong communicator with a proven ability to collaborate across engineering, operations, and external partners. 
Positive, collaborative, and energetic approach to teamwork.

Title: Chief Marketing Officer, Specialty Retail Brands
RoleDescription:
The base salary for this position is $216,000 - $228,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. This role is eligible for annual equity grants subject to Board approval and company performance. Typical grant ranges vary by level and may significantly impact total compensation.
Wayfairs Specialty Brands - AllModern, Birch Lane, and Joss & Main - are seeking a Chief Marketing Officer to drive the next chapter of growth. This executive will lead the brand and marketing strategy across our three distinct lifestyle brands, each with unique customer segments and positioning. With an ambitious roadmap that includes expanding brand awareness, growing our customer base, and scaling into physical retail, the CMO will play a critical role in shaping the future of these businesses.
The CMO will oversee a team of 25+ marketers and steward a significant media investment across brand, performance, CRM, promotions, on-site experience, and retail marketing. Were looking for a strategic and hands-on leader with deep expertise in both brand building and performance marketing - someone who thrives in fast-paced, entrepreneurial environments and brings proven success in the consumer goods and/or retail sectors.
This Boston-based role reports directly to the Wayfair Global CMO and partners closely with the General Manager of Specialty Brands as part of their leadership team.
What youll do

Own and oversee the management of a ~$100M+ advertising budget across all key platforms and channels, including, but not limited to, Google, Meta, Pinterest, TikTok, Audio and CTV partners, and relevant agencies (e.g. Org Social).
Develop and execute an integrated, multi-channel marketing strategy aligned with overall business goals and market-specific nuances.
Manage and optimize marketing initiatives across all key channels, including SEM, PLA, paid social, email marketing, SMS/Push notifications, display advertising, influencer/affiliate marketing, partnerships, online video, CTV/TV and more.
Leverage market insights across both our B2C and B2B customer segments to identify and prioritize opportunities for growth, customer acquisition, retention, and brand positioning.
Be the steward of each brand, working and driving key priorities with the dedicated Specialty Retail Creative team and the broader brand organization to ensure an elevated positioning and consistent brand presentation in line with the brand strategy.  
Analyze business performance and use data-driven decision-making processes to refine marketing strategies and optimize performance.
Stay current with evolving technology and identify ways to leverage it to drive efficiency gains and cost savings.
Build, mentor, and lead a high-performing marketing team, fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment.
Partner with senior leaders and x-functional teams to drive your agenda, including Pricing, Finance, Technology, Data Science, Design Services, Category Management, Physical Retail, Merchandising, Customer Service.
Engage with external agencies, vendors, and other stakeholders to leverage external expertise and amplify marketing efforts.
Develop and manage the marketing budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and maximum return on investment (ROI).
Partner with Finance to develop the brand forecast; monitor marketing spend and adjust as needed to ensure financial targets are met.

What Youll Need

10+ years of marketing experience, with a strong background in brand and performance marketing,  including physical retail experience. 
Demonstrated success in a senior marketing leadership role, preferably within the retail or consumer goods sector. Home,  design, or fashion industry experience is a plus.
Proven track record of driving growth, innovation, and brand excellence on a national scale.
Proficiency in data analytics, customer insights, and performance measurement tools.
Exceptional strategic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Strong understanding of digital marketing channels, platforms, and technologies.
Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and results-oriented environment.
